result.execSummary:
The defendant Damian D Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In lieu of costs defendant to serve 13 days Jail.  Sentence credit for 13 days granted.  TIME SERVED.

Straight time.
Sentence Credit for 90 days granted.  TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Damian D Payne in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1.
Sentence of:

90 Days jail .  (Credit - 90 days).  Time served.
COSTS:  $253.00 in lieu of costs defendant to serve 13 days, credit 13 days, TIME SERVED.

Prior: 6764 N 56th St, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Defendant Damian D Payne in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Damian D Payne in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorneys request sidebar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or any Sears store listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Damian D Payne in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
